content.verbatim_text: The leverage ratio is a non-risk-based measure defined as: Tier 1 Capital / Total Exposure Measure >= 3%. The exposure measure includes on-balance sheet items, derivatives, securities financing transactions, and off-balance sheet items. Unlike risk-weighted ratios, the leverage ratio provides a simple, transparent backstop.
content.title: Leverage Ratio

structured_data.relevance_to_odgs: Capital adequacy backstop — non-risk-weighted constraint for ODGS financial stability metrics
